intro: Onosma strigosissima, commonly known as the rough beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
